attributes.additional_details:
75% of 16 and 17 year olds voted in the Scottish independence referendum - higher than 18-24 year olds and evidence that young people can boost turnout in elections and other votes.

16 year olds can:

marry
join the army
consent to sex
pay taxes
get a job

Why shouldn't they be able to affect our parliament and our councils, our referendums and our mayors?
attributes.background:
We are a group of Year 11 students from Hornsey School for Girls and we believe that the voting age should be lowered to 16 because young people should have a say in the future of our country.

Issues like climate change are so important that we feel that everyone in society should have a say.

rejection.details:
There's a petition calling for the voting age to be lowered to 16 for general elections:

https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/265932

And a petition calling for the voting age to be lowered to 16 for general elections and referenda:

https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/269437
